videoSnippet.title: It Finally Paid Off! | Fier vs Vidal | Batumi Chess Olympiad (2018)
videoSnippet.description:
Check out the interview with Alexandr and make sure to congratulate him in the comments! :)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l5JNcCoPtPk&feature=share

Follow me on Instagram for extra content: https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Alexandr Hilario Takeda dos Santos Fier vs Robert Aloma Vidal
43rd Chess Olympiad (2018), Batumi GEO, rd 2, Sep-25 
Reti Opening: Reti Gambit (A09)

1. Nf3 d5 2. c4 dc4 3. Na3 a6 4. Nc4 b5 5. Ne3 Bb7 6. g3 Nf6 7. Bg2 e6 8. O-O Be7 9. b3 O-O 10. Bb2 c5 11. Qc2 Nbd7 12. Rac1 h6 13. Rfd1 Rc8 14. Qb1 Qb6 15. Qa1 Rfd8 16. h3 Bf8 17. d3 Bc6 18. Ng4 Ng4 19. hg4 Qb7 20. e4 a5 21. g5 hg5 22. Ng5 a4 23. Bh3 Re8 24. Kg2 ab3 25. Rh1 c4 26. Be6 Re6 27. Rh8

On the official website you will find all the basic information and daily reports, results, pairings, and the official press releases: 
http://batumi2018.fide.com/en

Twitter: @BatumiChess2018  (hashtag BatumiChess2018)
Facebook: www.facebook.com/batumi2018

This is the official link – just to have a look or to download!
www.flickr.com/photos/batumichessolympiad/albums

These pictures are provided to you for free as a courtesy from the organizers: please feel free to divulgue them and send them to the newspapers and chess columnists in your respective countries.

Qa1 Rfd8 16. h3 Bf8 17. d3 Bc6 18. Ng4 Nxg4 19. hxg4 Qb7 20. e4 a5 21. g5 hxg5 22. Nxg5 a4 23. Bh3 Re8 24. Kg2 axb3 25. Rh1 c4 26. Bxe6 Rxe6 27. Rh8+
videoGame.playerWhite: Alexandr Hilário Takeda Sakai dos Santos Fier

lichessGameEval.moves: Nf3 d5 c4 dxc4 Na3 a6 Nxc4 b5 Ne3 Bb7 g3 Nf6 Bg2 e6 O-O Be7 b3 O-O Bb2 c5 Qc2 Nbd7 Rac1 h6 Rfd1 Rc8 Qb1 Qb6 Qa1 Rfd8 h3 Bf8 d3 Bc6 Ng4 Nxg4 hxg4 Qb7 e4 a5 g5 hxg5 Nxg5 a4 Bh3 Re8 Kg2 axb3 Rh1 c4 Bxe6 Rxe6 Rh8+

analysis.variation: e3 Be6 Na3 c5 Nxc4 Nf6 Be2 g6 O-O Bg7
Nf6 axb3 Ra8 Qb1 Bd6 Kg1 e5 Qc2 Ra2 Bf5 g6 Bh3 b4 Bg2

judgment.name: Blunder
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Nf6 was best.

analysis.variation: Bf5 Nf6 Bxf6 Bxe4+ dxe4 gxf6 Rh8+ Kxh8 Rh1+ Kg8 Rh8+ Kxh8 Qh1+ Bh6

judgment.name: Blunder
judgment.comment: Lost forced checkmate sequence. Bf5 was best.
